rules.desc1: Each wave contains increasingly difficult pricing challenges that test your knowledge

survivalMode.question: Question
survivalMode.tipText: For Black-Scholes pricing, remember that the formula assumes log-normal distribution of returns and constant volatility

blackScholes.title: Black-Scholes Calculator
blackScholes.description: Calculate option prices and Greeks using the Black-Scholes-Merton model
blackScholes.aboutText: The Black-Scholes model is a mathematical model for pricing European-style options. It assumes that the price of the underlying follows a geometric Brownian motion with constant volatility and that markets are frictionless.

greeks.title: Greeks Simulator
greeks.description: Visualize how option Greeks change with respect to different parameters
greeks.aboutText: Greeks measure the sensitivity of option prices to various factors. Delta measures price change relative to underlying, gamma measures the rate of change of delta, vega measures sensitivity to volatility, and theta measures time decay.

yieldCurve.title: Yield Curve Visualizer
yieldCurve.description: Visualize and analyze zero-coupon yield curves and forward rates
yieldCurve.aboutText: Yield curves display zero-coupon bond yields for different maturities. Spot rates represent current yields while forward rates anticipate future spot rates. These curves are essential for interest rate product pricing and macroeconomic analysis.

binomial.title: Binomial Calculator
binomial.description: Price options using the binomial tree model with visual representation
binomial.aboutText: The binomial model is a numerical method for option valuation. It discretizes time to expiration into multiple steps, with two possible movements at each step (up or down). This model is particularly useful for American options and path-dependent exotic structures.
